fields.value: HIV/AIDS and the Key Population: Monitoring of media reports (2006- 2010) in six high prevalence Indian states

dsDescriptionValue.value: Under the media analysis initiative, a key focus of the advocacy initiative was to track the news/messages related to HIV and the key population in six states (e.g. Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Karnataka, Maharashtra, Manipur and Nagaland), where the Avahan program was being undertaken. It was recognized that to be able to work closely with stakeholders such as program implementers, policy makers, community on the one hand and the media on the other; it was essential to track what was being placed on the media domain; the discourse outside the media domain, the gaps, people who were being projected on the media and the messages. The 22 districts across six states were selected based on the criteria of those areas where Avahan NGOs were intervening on the ground. Needless to state the main criteria of selection of the districts, newspapers were based on the advocacy interventions that were being planned in the state i.e. journalists to be trained; districts in which the program was strong, or community leaders who would be able to help shape the media discourse amongst others.

keywordValue.value: HIV/AIDS, Key population, Media analysis, News clips;  INSTITUTION: CFAR;  STRATEGIC AREA: Media advocacy studies

publicationCitation.value: HIV/AIDS and the Key Population: Monitoring of media reports (2006- 2010) in four high prevalence southern Indian states of AP, Karnataka, Maharashtra and TN: Description note on the archive of media reports

value: Report on "HIV/AIDS and the Key Population: Monitoring of media reports (2006- 2010) in four high prevalence southern Indian states of AP, Karnataka, Maharashtra and TN"

fields.value:
The database comprises of the newspaper, magazine, online, radio and television clips on HIV and the key population (PLHIV, MSM, SW, TG, IDU) tracked across over 260 English and language editions across six states (Karnataka
, Andhra Pradesh, Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu, Manipur and Nagaland) from 2005 to 2011.  Electronic tracking was done regularly only in Tamil Nadu. In the other states, it was monitored occasionally or dependent on events supported where the electronic media attended. Over all 264 newspapers were tracked (224 - State, 40 - National), out of which 107 were English languages and 157 were in other language editions (Kannada, Tamil, Manipuri, Hindi, Telugu, Marathi). Approximately 54,000 news clips were tracked during this period (2005-2011) from six states and 22 districts.  (The following districts were tracked by rotation - Kolhapur, Yavatmal, Mumbai, Nasik, Guntur, West Godavari, Chittoor, Warangal, Mangalore, Gulbarga, Hubli, Belgaum, Tirunelveli, Vellore, Namakkal, Madurai, Salem, Coimbatore).

files.description: The data for Media Analysis on HIV/AIDS and the key population are available for four states only (Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka, Maharashtra and Tamil Nadu) for year 2006-2010
